description: Construction of single-storey building to the north-west of the site and associated canopy (Regulation 3 Application by London Borough of Ealing).
decision_conditions: The development hereby approved shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with document/drawing reference: Ground Investigation Report, report ref C14933, prepared by Ground Engineering Limited, dated February 2020; Tree Survey and Tree Constraints Plan, ref GD/200167R1/sh, prepared by Bartlett Consulting, dated 15.05.2020; Ambient Noise Assessment, ref R8507-1-Rev-0, prepared by 24 Acoustics, dated 29.05.2020; Preliminary Ecological Appraisal, ref PEA/BTE/Fielding, prepared by Urban Wildlife Limited, dated 03.07.2020; PL-AB104; PL-AB103; PL-AB102; PL-AB101; Design & Access Statement-Rev-2, ref EC1351-DAS, prepared by Ealing Council, dated September 2020; PL-AL-107; PL-AL-107; PL-AL-105; PL-AL-104; PL-AL-102; PL-AL-101.

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning. | a) Prior to commencement of the development hereby approved, an Interim School Travel Plan shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.

b) The school shall achieve at least a Bronze STARS accreditation within one year of the first use of the development hereby permitted. A minimum of a Bronze STARS accreditation (or equivalent) shall be maintained in perpetuity.

Reason: To promote the use of sustainable modes of transport and minimise traffic and parking congestion on neighbouring streets in accordance with Principle 9 of the NPPF, Policies T1, T2, T4 and T5, and Ealing's Sustainable Transport for New Development SPD. | Prior to the first use of the school development hereby permitted, a minimum of four additional covered/sheltered cycle parking spaces shall be installed onsite and permanently retained as such thereafter.

Reason: To promote the use of sustainable modes of transport and minimise traffic and parking congestion on neighbouring streets in accordance with Principle 9 of the NPPF, Policies T1, T2, T4 and T5, and Ealing's Sustainable Transport for New Development SPD. | The individual and combined external sound level emitted from plant, machinery or equipment/ extraction/ventilation system and ducting at the development site shall be lower than the lowest existing background sound level by at least 10dBA, as measured at/calculated to the nearest and most affected noise sensitive premises at the development site and surrounding premises. The assessment shall be made in accordance with BS4142:2014, with all machinery operating together at maximum capacity.

Reason: To ensure that amenity is not adversely affected by noise from mechanical equipment, in accordance with Policies D13 and D14 of The London Plan, Policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD and Ealing Council's SPG 10 - Noise and Vibration. | Prior to use of machinery, plant, or equipment/extraction/ventilation system and ducting, these shall be mounted with proprietary anti-vibration isolators and fan motors shall be vibration isolated from the casing and adequately silenced and maintained as such permanently thereafter.

Reason: To ensure that amenity is not adversely affected by noise from mechanical equipment, in accordance with Policies D13 and D14 of The London Plan, Policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD and Ealing Council's SPG 10 - Noise and Vibration. | (a) A minimum of at least 80 sq. m. of green roof, shall be laid out in accordance with the approved roof plan (PL-AB102).
(b) Prior to the first use of the approved development, a five-year post planting green roof maintenance and inspection schedule, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.

(c) The approved green roof shall be installed within the first planting season following the first use of the approved development, at the latest. The green roof shall be retained as such thereafter and the approved maintenance plan shall be adhered to in perpetuity.

Reason:  To ensure the development contributes towards urban greening and biodiversity in accordance with Principle 15 of the NPPF, Policy G1, G5 and G6 of The London Plan, Greater London Authority, Living Roofs and Walls, Technical Report: Supporting London Plan Policy and Policy 5.11 of Ealing's Development Management DPD. | Prior to the first use of the development hereby approved, bird boxes shall be installed in accordance with the approved Preliminary Ecological Appraisal, ref PEA/BTE/Fielding, prepared by Urban Wildlife Limited, dated 03.07.2020 i.e. a minimum of two additional nesting bird habitat bricks for house sparrows, on the south face of the building, and a minimum of two nesting habitat bricks for starlings, positioned at opposing ends of the south-east wall.
Reason: To enhance onsite biodiversity in accordance with Paragraph 174 of the National Planning Policy Framework.
